original: Bjuring, Ernfrid, musikdirektör, Ronneby, f. 28/6/96 i Flisby, Jönköp. 1. G. 21 m. Nenna Rooth. Barn: Sven f. 24, korresp. — Organistex. i Linköp. 12, kantorsex. där 14, elev v. musikhögsk. 13, organistex. där 15, musiklär:- o. kantorsex. där 23, stud. i kontrapunkt f. prof. E. Eliberg, Sthlm, i orgelspeln. f. prof. Franz Sauer, Salzburg, 29. Vik. domkyrkoorganist o. musiklär. i Strängnäs 17-18, organist o. kantor i Ronneby sed. 18, musiklär. v. Ronneby samrealsk. sed. 18, vik. rektor v. Ronneby samrealsk. somr. 40-43. Ordf. o-, dirig. f. Ronneby kyrkokör o. dirig. f. Ronneby manskör, andre förb :dirig. f. Blek. 1. sångarförb. 36-44 o. f. Blek. kör-förb. sed. 35, led. av styr. f. Lunds stifts organist- o. kantorsfören. sed. 36, sekr. där 38, v. ordf. sed. 41, led. av styr. f. Musiklär. riksförb. sed. 41, ombudsman där sed. 39, v. ordf. sed. 41, led. av övningslär :organisatio-nens centr:råd sed. 42, suppl. i centr:-styr. f. Sv:es allm. organist- o. kan-torsförb. ’sed. 39, kd. o. v. ordf. där fr. 47, led. av Ronneby stads folksk:-styr. ised. 41, av finansmin. kallad t. överläggn. m. 41 års lär :ilönesakk. 42-46. Musikhögsk. jeton f. framist. orgelspeln.
translated: Bjuring, Ernfrid, music director, Ronneby, born June 28, 1896 in Flisby, Jönköping. Married to Nenna Rooth in 1921. Children: Sven (born 1924), correspondent. He graduated with a degree in organ playing from Linköping in 1912 and received his church music degree there in 1914. He was a student at the music college in 1913 and received his organ degree from there in 1915. He also received his degree in music teaching and church music from there in 1923 and studied counterpoint with Professor E. Eliberg in Stockholm and organ playing with Professor Franz Sauer in Salzburg in 1929. He was a temporary cathedral organist and music teacher in Strängnäs from 1917 to 1918, and an organist and choirmaster in Ronneby since 1918. He was also a music teacher at Ronneby secondary school since 1918 and was a temporary principal there from 1940 to 1943. He was chairman and conductor of the Ronneby church choir and conductor of the Ronneby men's choir. He was the second national conductor of the Blekinge Singers' Association from 1936 to 1944 and the national conductor of the Blekinge Choir Association since 1935. He was a member of the board of the Lund Diocese Organist and Choirmaster Association since 1936, secretary there since 1938, and vice-chairman since 1941. He was a member of the board of the National Music Teachers' Association since 1941, its representative since 1939, vice-chairman since 1941, and a substitute in the central board of the Swedish Organist and Choirmaster Association since 1939. He was a member and vice-chairman of the Ronneby city primary school board since 1941 and was called to consult with the 1941 Teacher Salary Committee from 1942 to 1946. He was awarded a music college token for future organ playing.
